result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine Hill

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antoine Hill in court.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court for Antoine Hill.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the state and requests adjourned Status conference.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Conference set for 10/25/2022 at 1:30 pm has been rescheduled to10/28/2022 at 8:30 a.m.  Matter was originally set early in the week on Jury Trial week.

Adjustment Number: 22A 079334,
Payable Number: 1026746,
Receipt Number: 22RP033259,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Antoine Hill in court, appear in person with attorney Theodore OReilly, appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.   
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the  cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antoine Hill in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
07/07/22.    22RM033268
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/29/22 @ 2p
